result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Mindy J. Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mindy J. Hayes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mindy J. Hayes was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Def is to complete 40 hours of uncompensated community service.

Def must attend, pay for and successfully complete anger management.

Def is to pay restitution in the amount of $1236.04.

Def is to pay costs of action and costs of probation.

Court waives DNA surcharge.

Parties stipulate to zero days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: clerk follow up with ADA re. bond. No new bond for DPA was requested at sentencing. Bond continues.
Diversion Agreement

Attorney David William Franker in court with Defendant Mindy J. Hayes. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached resolution. Plea agreement recited to Court. Colloquy re. plea questionnaire/waiver of rights. Def pleads NC to counts 4 & 5. Further colloquy. Court finds factual basis for charges, accepts def's plea and finds her guilty of counts 4 & 5. Comment re. sentencing. 

Sentencing: Ct 4-withhold sentence, place def on Diversion agreement - 1 year. Ct 5: sentence withheld for 12 months probation. Conditions: 40 hours uncompensated community service, def must attend, pay for and successfully complete anger management, pay restitution of $1236.04, def is to pay costs of action (no DNA surcharge). Zero credit in event of revocation. Cts 1-3 are dismissed.

Status conference at 02-18-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Mindy J. Hayes in court with attorney David W. Franker. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Information filed.  NG pleas entered.  Atty. Franker asks for plea/sentencing date; states that def is working on paying the restitution.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on December 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Franker.  Atty. Franker advises the Court that this is a waiver of prelim.  Colloquy re waiver.  Argnt set for 12-3 at 10.  Arraignment scheduled for 12-03-2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Franker.  Matter called as status - was set for prelim today.  Atty. Franker states that the parties may want a prelim but do not believe so at this time; asks that the matter be reset as a prelim with the understanding that it's more likely to end up as a status.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 10-15-2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Franker.  Atty. Franker states that plea offer was received this morning; defense wants more time to consider that offer; for now, wants prelim scheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 08-20-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Franker as his first appearance.  Court has informed def of her rights.  Re prelim, Atty. Franker states that the def will waive the time limits.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for 07-02-2014 at 01:30 pm.

email from SPD - def now qualifies for SPD; appointment will be made
Adjourned initial appearance on June 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADA Forehand appears for the State of Wisconsin, MH appears w/o counsel. MH waives reading of complaint. Court reads maximum penalties. MH states she has tried contacting an attorney and asks for more time. Court so orders. Matter set for Adjourned Initial Appearance on 06-04-2014 @ 10:00 a.m.
